definition: lit. to face the corner (idiom)/fig. to miss out on sth
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.chinese: 呜咽，唯有你单独向隅而泣。

sentences.english: Lord of my heart, no more shall there be for me waiting and weeping in corners, no more coyness and sweetness of demeanour.
sentences.chinese: 我心灵的主，我不会再向隅而泣，也不再畏怯娇羞。

sentences.english: People fled toward the Sumida River, drowning by the hundreds when bridges collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 人们都逃向隅田川，当桥塌陷时淹死了几百人。

sentences.english: Space is limited, please submit this form ASAP.
sentences.chinese: 因名额有限，请尽速将本表寄回，以免向隅。
哭泣，只有你独自向隅哭泣。

sentences.english: Seats are limited, please register at your earliest convenience.
sentences.chinese: 座位有限，欲免向隅，请尽早登记。

definition: to feel powerless and full of shame (idiom)
to crane one's neck/(fig.) with one's neck outstretched in expectation
to raise one's head and look
